turns.raw_header: You used the tag `!<q>` before your message. That isn’t a standard, widely recognized command in common chat or programming contexts, so I’ll treat it as a custom marker—possibly meaning “quote,” “question,” or just a prefix your system/tool uses.
turns.body:
Your message content is:

> test

If you’re testing:
- I can see and respond to your message normally.
- You can send follow‑up questions or instructions without the `!<q>` if you like, unless your environment requires it.
turns.footer: Tell me what you’d like to try next (e.g., “explain X,” “summarize Y,” “help me write Z”).

parsed_footer.raw: Tell me what you’d like to try next (e.g., “explain X,” “summarize Y,” “help me write Z”).

turns.raw_header: I see the `!<o>` tag this time—like `!<q>`, it’s not a standard command I recognize, so I’ll just treat it as a prefix and focus on the content:
turns.body:
> second test

Your messages are coming through correctly.
turns.footer: If these tags have a specific meaning in your setup (e.g., `!<q>` = question, `!<o>` = output, or different roles), tell me how you’d like me to interpret them and I’ll adapt.
